column5: A rousing folk song celebrates daring poachers outwitting gamekeepers, turning lawbreakers into local heroes. Though once rebellious, “The Lincolnshire Poacher” has become a county emblem and even a military march

“Brigg Fair” is a well-known local folk song about a young man going to the fair to meet his sweetheart, first recorded in 1907 when Percy Grainger captured Joseph Taylor singing it on wax cylinder. Rooted in Romany tradition and tied to Brigg’s centuries-old horse fair, it became one of Lincolnshire’s most famous folk melodies

Horkstow Grange survives mainly as a folk song telling of a quarrel between a farm bailiff and a worker known as John “Steeleye” Span. Collected by Percy Grainger in the early 1900s, the ballad later gave its name to the band Steeleye Span and remains one of the best-known Lincolnshire-set songs
